parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>False. While the post mentions PSD and PNL, it does not refer to specific candidates by name or surname.  The analysis focuses on the political system and institutions (CCR, BEC, CSAT), not individual candidates.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is published on a public Facebook page ("Comunitatea Liberală 1848") and is a paid advertisement, clearly intending to reach a wide audience, not just specific individuals.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The post's objective is debatable. While it discusses the political climate two days before the elections and mentions PSD and PNL, it doesn't explicitly urge voters to vote for or against any specific candidate. The main focus seems to be raising concerns about the fairness and transparency of the electoral process, potentially influencing public opinion regarding the political system's integrity rather than directly influencing votes for particular candidates.  The argument presented is more of a political commentary than a direct call to action for a specific candidate.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>The post presents itself as a political commentary or analysis, similar to an opinion piece in a newspaper. It raises questions about the political situation and offers an interpretation of events. While it expresses a clear political stance, it does not explicitly endorse or oppose any candidate. The style and content align more with journalistic analysis than direct electoral propaganda.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>While the post expresses a strong opinion about the state of Romanian politics, it does so within the framework of political analysis and commentary, not as a personal attack or emotional appeal unrelated to the election. The opinion is presented as an interpretation of events, not as a personal feeling.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>992810739531453</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The post, while published during the electoral period and discussing relevant political parties, does not directly advocate for or against any specific candidate. It focuses on broader concerns about the electoral process and the actions of political institutions.  While it could indirectly influence voter perception of the involved parties, this indirect influence is not sufficient to classify it as electoral propaganda under Article 98 t) given the lack of direct calls to action for or against specific candidates. The analysis presented is more akin to political commentary than direct electoral campaigning.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>FALSE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates/>
<responsible-party-or-group>Comunitatea Liberală 1848</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police/>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
